solution_line_template: Four times Zion's age is {zion_age} x {multiplier_four_times} = <<{zion_age}*{multiplier_four_times}={four_times_zion_age}>>{four_times_zion_age}.
So Zion's dad is {four_times_zion_age} + {dad_more_than_four_times} = <<{four_times_zion_age}+{dad_more_than_four_times}={dad_age_current}>>{dad_age_current} years old.
In {years_in_future} years, Zion will be {zion_age} + {years_in_future} = <<{zion_age}+{years_in_future}={zion_age_future}>>{zion_age_future} years old.
In {years_in_future} years, Zion's dad will be {dad_age_current} + {years_in_future} = <<{dad_age_current}+{years_in_future}={dad_age_future}>>{dad_age_future} years old.

Hence, in {years_in_future} years, Zion's dad will be {dad_age_future} - {zion_age_future} = <<{dad_age_future}-{zion_age_future}={age_difference_future}>>{age_difference_future} years older than Zion.
